required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pharmacokinetic, Efficacy, and Safety Study of Octafibrin Compared to Haemocomplettan/Riastap
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective, Controlled, Randomised, Crossover Study Investigating the Pharmacokinetic Properties, Surrogate Efficacy and Safety of Octafibrin Compared to Haemocomplettan® P/RiaSTAPTM in Patients With Congenital Fibrinogen Deficiency

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to investigate pharmacokinetic properties, surrogate efficacy and safety of Octafibrin compared to Haemocomplettan® P/RiaSTAPTM in patients with congenital fibrinogen deficiency

primary_outcome.measure: Ratio of Octafibrin/FIBRYGA® to Haemocomplettan® P/RiaSTAP(TM) for Fibrinogen Activity Normalized Area Under the Curve Unstandardized
primary_outcome.description: Fibrinogen activity was determined via a validated Clauss assay (fibrinogen activity) and fibrinogen-specific enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ie, fibrinogen antigen) using paired antibodies for fibrinogen antigen. All determinations were performed on frozen plasma samples in a central laboratory. The Clauss assay was modified and validated to achieve a limit of quantification of 0.2 g/L. The pharmacokinetic analysis was assessed individually using a non-compartmental model. Plasma levels were measured at Baseline, and at 0.5, 1, 2, 4, 8, 24, 48, 96, 144, 216, and 312 hours post-treatment. The mean ratio of normalized area under the curve was calculated as Octafibrin/FIBRYGA® over Haemocomplettan® P/RiaSTAP(TM)

primary_outcome.measure: Comparison of Maximum Clot Firmness Between Octafibrin/FIBRYGA® and Haemocomplettan® P/RiaSTAP(TM) at 1 hr Post Infusion
primary_outcome.description: Thromboelastometry (ROTEM®) was used to measure maximum clot firmness. Thromboelastometry is a method for the continuous measurement of clot formation. Maximum clot firmness is a functional parameter that depends on the activation of coagulation, the platelet and fibrinogen content of the blood sample, and the polymerisation and cross-linking of the fibrin network. In order to obtain comparable results from all study centres, maximum clot firmness data were assessed from frozen citrated plasma samples in a central laboratory. As these samples did not contain platelets that would be found in the whole blood assay, the fibrinogen content primarily defined the maximum clot firmness.

secondary_outcome.measure: Fibrinogen Activity Normalized Area Under the Curve Unstandardized
secondary_outcome.description: Fibrinogen activity was determined via a validated Clauss assay (fibrinogen activity) and fibrinogen-specific enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ie, fibrinogen antigen) using paired antibodies for fibrinogen antigen. All determinations were performed on frozen plasma samples in a central laboratory. The Clauss assay was modified and validated to achieve a limit of quantification of 0.2 g/L. The pharmacokinetic analysis was assessed individually using a non-compartmental model. Plasma levels were measured at Baseline, and at 0.5, 1, 2, 4, 8, 24, 48, 96, 144, 216, and 312 hours post-treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Fibrinogen Activity Normalized Area Under the Curve Standardized
secondary_outcome.description: Fibrinogen activity was determined via a validated Clauss assay (fibrinogen activity) and fibrinogen-specific enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ie, fibrinogen antigen) using paired antibodies for fibrinogen antigen. All determinations were performed on frozen plasma samples in a central laboratory. The Clauss assay was modified and validated to achieve a limit of quantification of 0.2 g/L. The pharmacokinetic analysis was assessed individually using a non-compartmental model. Plasma levels were measured at Baseline, and at 0.5, 1, 2, 4, 8, 24, 48, 96, 144, 216, and 312 hours post-treatment. The normalized area under the curve was standardized to a dose of 70 mg/kg.

Fibrinogen activity was determined via a validated Clauss assay (fibrinogen activity) and fibrinogen-specific enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ie, fibrinogen antigen) using paired antibodies for fibrinogen antigen. All determinations were performed on frozen plasma samples in a central laboratory. The Clauss assay was modified and validated to achieve a limit of quantification of 0.2 g/L. The pharmacokinetic analysis was assessed individually using a non-compartmental model. Plasma levels were measured at Baseline, and at 0.5, 1, 2, 4, 8, 24, 48, 96, 144, 216, and 312 hours post-treatment.

Fibrinogen activity was determined via a validated Clauss assay (fibrinogen activity) and fibrinogen-specific enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ie, fibrinogen antigen) using paired antibodies for fibrinogen antigen. All determinations were performed on frozen plasma samples in a central laboratory. The Clauss assay was modified and validated to achieve a limit of quantification of 0.2 g/L. The pharmacokinetic analysis was assessed individually using a non-compartmental model. Plasma levels were measured at Baseline, and at 0.5, 1, 2, 4, 8, 24, 48, 96, 144, 216, and 312 hours post-treatment.

Fibrinogen activity was determined via a validated Clauss assay (fibrinogen activity) and fibrinogen-specific enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ie, fibrinogen antigen) using paired antibodies for fibrinogen antigen. All determinations were performed on frozen plasma samples in a central laboratory. The Clauss assay was modified and validated to achieve a limit of quantification of 0.2 g/L. The pharmacokinetic analysis was assessed individually using a non-compartmental model. Plasma levels were measured at Baseline, and at 0.5, 1, 2, 4, 8, 24, 48, 96, 144, 216, and 312 hours post-treatment. The maximum plasma concentration was standardized to a dose of 70 mg/kg.

Incremental in vivo recovery was calculated as the maximum increase in plasma fibrinogen (fibrinogen activity assay data) within 4 hours post-treatment as compared with pre-treatment (expressed as an absolute mg/dL concentration in plasma), divided by the exact dose of Octafibrin/FIBRYGA® or Haemocomplettan® P/RiaSTAP(TM) (expressed as mg/kg dosed).

Classical in vivo recovery was calculated as: 100 x the maximum increase in plasma fibrinogen (fibrinogen activity assay data) within 4 hours post-treatment as compared with pre-treatment (expressed as an absolute mg/dL concentration in plasma) x the plasma volume (mL), divided by the exact dose of Octafibrin/FIBRYGA® or Haemocomplettan® P/RiaSTAP(TM) (expressed as mg).

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Reach Maximum Plasma Concentration (Tmax)
secondary_outcome.description: Fibrinogen activity was determined via a validated Clauss assay (fibrinogen activity) and fibrinogen-specific enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ie, fibrinogen antigen) using paired antibodies for fibrinogen antigen. All determinations were performed on frozen plasma samples in a central laboratory. The Clauss assay was modified and validated to achieve a limit of quantification of 0.2 g/L. All determinations were performed on frozen plasma samples in a central laboratory. The Clauss assay was modified and validated to achieve a limit of quantification of 0.2 g/L. The pharmacokinetic analysis was assessed individually using a non-compartmental model. Plasma levels were measured at Baseline, and at 0.5, 1, 2, 4, 8, 24, 48, 96, 144, 216, and 312 hours post-treatment.

Fibrinogen activity was determined via a validated Clauss assay (fibrinogen activity) and fibrinogen-specific enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ie, fibrinogen antigen) using paired antibodies for fibrinogen antigen. All determinations were performed on frozen plasma samples in a central laboratory. The Clauss assay was modified and validated to achieve a limit of quantification of 0.2 g/L. The pharmacokinetic analysis was assessed individually using a non-compartmental model. Plasma levels were measured at Baseline, and at 0.5, 1, 2, 4, 8, 24, 48, 96, 144, 216, and 312 hours post-treatment.

Fibrinogen activity was determined via a validated Clauss assay (fibrinogen activity) and fibrinogen-specific enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ie, fibrinogen antigen) using paired antibodies for fibrinogen antigen. All determinations were performed on frozen plasma samples in a central laboratory. The Clauss assay was modified and validated to achieve a limit of quantification of 0.2 g/L. The pharmacokinetic analysis was assessed individually using a non-compartmental model. Plasma levels were measured at Baseline, and at 0.5, 1, 2, 4, 8, 24, 48, 96, 144, 216, and 312 hours post-treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Volume of Distribution at Steady State (Vss)
secondary_outcome.description: Fibrinogen activity was determined via a validated Clauss assay (fibrinogen activity) and fibrinogen-specific enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ie, fibrinogen antigen) using paired antibodies for fibrinogen antigen. All determinations were performed on frozen plasma samples in a central laboratory. The Clauss assay was modified and validated to achieve a limit of quantification of 0.2 g/L. The pharmacokinetic analysis was assessed individually using a non-compartmental model. Plasma levels were measured at Baseline, and at 0.5, 1, 2, 4, 8, 24, 48, 96, 144, 216, and 312 hours post-treatment.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Octafibrin followed by Haemocomplettan® P or RiaSTAPTM
arm_group.description: Participants received Octafibrin 70 mg/kg intravenously once followed by Haemocomplettan® P or RiaSTAPTM 70 mg/kg intravenously once 45 days later.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Haemocomplettan® P or RiaSTAPTM followed by Octafibrin
arm_group.description: Participants received Haemocomplettan® P or RiaSTAPTM 70 mg/kg intravenously once followed by Octafibrin 70 mg/kg intravenously once 45 days later.

intervention.description: Octafibrin was supplied as a powder for reconstitution with water for injection.
intervention.arm_group_label: Octafibrin followed by Haemocomplettan® P or RiaSTAPTM
Haemocomplettan® P or RiaSTAPTM followed by Octafibrin

intervention.description: Commercially available Haemocomplettan® P or RiaSTAPTM (same product with different names in different markets) were supplied as powders for reconstitution with water for injection.
intervention.arm_group_label: Octafibrin followed by Haemocomplettan® P or RiaSTAPTM
Haemocomplettan® P or RiaSTAPTM followed by Octafibrin

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age ≥ 12 years.
- Documented congenital fibrinogen deficiency (afibrinogenemia).
Exclusion Criteria:
- Life expectancy > 6 month.
- Bleeding disorder other than congenital fibrinogen deficiency.
- Presence or history of hypersensitivity to study medication.
- Presence or history of deep vein thrombosis or pulmonary embolism within 1 year prior to enrollment.
- Presence or history of arterial thrombosis with 1 year prior to enrollment.
- Hypersensitivity to human plasma products.
- Acute bleeding.
- Pregnant or currently breast-feeding women.
- Suspicion of an anti-fibrinogen inhibitor as indicated by previous in vivo recovery (if available).
- Blood or plasma donation in the 3 months prior to enrollment.
- Human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) positive with a viral load > 200 particles/µl or > 400000 copies/mL.
- End-stage liver disease.
- History of oesophageal varicose bleeding.

facility.name: University of Colorado Hemophilia & Thrombosis Center
Cohen Children's Medical Center of New York
Specialized Hospital for Active Treatment "Joan Pavel"
Department of Hematology St. John's Medical College Hospital
Department of Hematology Christian Medical College
Nemazee Hospital Shiraz University of Medical Sciences
The Centre for Haemostatis and Thrombosis

group.title: Octafibrin/FIBRYGA® Followed by Haemocomplettan® P/RiaSTAP(TM)
group.description: Participants received Octafibrin/FIBRYGA® 70 mg/kg body weight (BW) intravenously once followed by Haemocomplettan® P/RiaSTAP(TM) 70 mg/kg BW intravenously once 45 days later.

group.title: Haemocomplettan® P/RiaSTAP(TM) Followed by Octafibrin/FIBRYGA®
group.description: Participants received Haemocomplettan® P/RiaSTAP(TM) 70 mg/kg BW intravenously once followed by Octafibrin/FIBRYGA® 70 mg/kg BW intravenously once 45 days later.

baseline.population: Full analysis set: All randomised participants who received at least 1 infusion of study medication (Octafibrin/FIBRYGA® and/or any part of an infusion of Haemocomplettan® P/RiaSTAP(TM)) and for whom any post-treatment data were available.

group.title: Full Analysis Set
group.description: All randomised participants who received at least 1 infusion of study medication (Octafibrin/FIBRYGA® and/or any part of an infusion of Haemocomplettan® P/RiaSTAP(TM)) and for whom any post-treatment data were available.

outcome.title: Ratio of Octafibrin/FIBRYGA® to Haemocomplettan® P/RiaSTAP(TM) for Fibrinogen Activity Normalized Area Under the Curve Unstandardized
outcome.description: Fibrinogen activity was determined via a validated Clauss assay (fibrinogen activity) and fibrinogen-specific enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ie, fibrinogen antigen) using paired antibodies for fibrinogen antigen. All determinations were performed on frozen plasma samples in a central laboratory. The Clauss assay was modified and validated to achieve a limit of quantification of 0.2 g/L. The pharmacokinetic analysis was assessed individually using a non-compartmental model. Plasma levels were measured at Baseline, and at 0.5, 1, 2, 4, 8, 24, 48, 96, 144, 216, and 312 hours post-treatment. The mean ratio of normalized area under the curve was calculated as Octafibrin/FIBRYGA® over Haemocomplettan® P/RiaSTAP(TM)
outcome.population: Pharmacokinetic (PK)-per protocol dataset: All randomised participants who received ≥ 90% of the treatment (T) doses, had any post-T data, did not receive any fibrinogen (F) containing blood products between T and 14 days post-T in both study periods; had sufficient PK data for analysis; had a ≥ 50 mg/dL increase in plasma F within 4 hours post-T.

group.title: Pharmacokinetic (PK)-Per Protocol Dataset
group.description: Ratio comparison of participants who received Octafibrin/FIBRYGA® 70 mg/kg body weight (BW) intravenously once, and participants who received Haemocomplettan® P/RiaSTAP(TM) 70 mg/kg BW intravenously once

group.description: Participants received Octafibrin/FIBRYGA® 70 mg/kg body weight (BW) intravenously once.

group.title: Haemocomplettan® P/RiaSTAP(TM)
group.description: Participants received Haemocomplettan® P/RiaSTAP(TM) 70 mg/kg BW intravenously once.

measure.title: Incremental in Vivo Recovery
measure.description: Incremental in vivo recovery was calculated as the maximum increase in plasma fibrinogen (fibrinogen activity assay data) within 4 hours post-treatment as compared with pre-treatment (expressed as an absolute mg/dL concentration in plasma), divided by the exact dose of Octafibrin/FIBRYGA® or Haemocomplettan® P/RiaSTAP(TM) (expressed as mg/kg dosed).
measure.population: Pharmacokinetic (PK)-per protocol dataset: All randomised participants who received ≥ 90% of the treatment (T) doses, had any post-T data, did not receive any fibrinogen (F) containing blood products between T and 14 days post-T in both study periods; had sufficient PK data for analysis; had a ≥ 50 mg/dL increase in plasma F within 4 hours post-T.

outcome.title: Classical in Vivo Recovery
outcome.description: Classical in vivo recovery was calculated as: 100 x the maximum increase in plasma fibrinogen (fibrinogen activity assay data) within 4 hours post-treatment as compared with pre-treatment (expressed as an absolute mg/dL concentration in plasma) x the plasma volume (mL), divided by the exact dose of Octafibrin/FIBRYGA® or Haemocomplettan® P/RiaSTAP(TM) (expressed as mg).
outcome.population: Pharmacokinetic (PK)-per protocol dataset: All randomised participants who received ≥ 90% of the treatment (T) doses, had any post-T data, did not receive any fibrinogen (F) containing blood products between T and 14 days post-T in both study periods; had sufficient PK data for analysis; had a ≥ 50 mg/dL increase in plasma F within 4 hours post-T.

group.title: Octafibrin/FIBRYGA®
group.description: Participants received Octafibrin/FIBRYGA® 70 mg/kg body weight (BW) intravenously once.

group.title: Haemocomplettan® P/RiaSTAP(TM)
group.description: Participants received Haemocomplettan® P/RiaSTAP(TM) 70 mg/kg BW intravenously once.

measure.title: Classical in Vivo Recovery
measure.description: Classical in vivo recovery was calculated as: 100 x the maximum increase in plasma fibrinogen (fibrinogen activity assay data) within 4 hours post-treatment as compared with pre-treatment (expressed as an absolute mg/dL concentration in plasma) x the plasma volume (mL), divided by the exact dose of Octafibrin/FIBRYGA® or Haemocomplettan® P/RiaSTAP(TM) (expressed as mg).
measure.population: Pharmacokinetic (PK)-per protocol dataset: All randomised participants who received ≥ 90% of the treatment (T) doses, had any post-T data, did not receive any fibrinogen (F) containing blood products between T and 14 days post-T in both study periods; had sufficient PK data for analysis; had a ≥ 50 mg/dL increase in plasma F within 4 hours post-T.

outcome.title: Time to Reach Maximum Plasma Concentration (Tmax)
outcome.description: Fibrinogen activity was determined via a validated Clauss assay (fibrinogen activity) and fibrinogen-specific enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ie, fibrinogen antigen) using paired antibodies for fibrinogen antigen. All determinations were performed on frozen plasma samples in a central laboratory. The Clauss assay was modified and validated to achieve a limit of quantification of 0.2 g/L. The pharmacokinetic analysis was assessed individually using a non-compartmental model. Plasma levels were measured at Baseline, and at 0.5, 1, 2, 4, 8, 24, 48, 96, 144, 216, and 312 hours post-treatment.
outcome.population: Pharmacokinetic (PK)-per protocol dataset: All randomised participants who received ≥ 90% of the treatment (T) doses, had any post-T data, did not receive any fibrinogen (F) containing blood products between T and 14 days post-T in both study periods; had sufficient PK data for analysis; had a ≥ 50 mg/dL increase in plasma F within 4 hours post-T.

reported_events.desc: Safety analysis dataset: All randomised participants who received at least 1 infusion of study medication (any part of an infusion of Octafibrin/FIBRYGA® and/or any part of an infusion of Haemocomplettan® P/RiaSTAP(TM)).

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Octapharma agreements may vary with individual investigators, but will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. Octapharma supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial but requests that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial. Octapharma also reserves the right to review data prior to publishing and provide comments/changes within a certain time period.
